greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Variation on A029834: a discrete version of the Mangoldt function. If n is prime then floor(log(prime(n)) else 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = delta(tau(n), 2) * floor(log(prime(n)) = A010051(n) * A029835(n), where delta is the Kronecker delta function and tau is the number of divisors function. - _Alonso del Arte_, Sep 11 2013
example: a(5) = 2 because the fifth prime is 11, the logarithm of which is 2.397895...
a(7) = 2 because the seventh prime is 17, the logarithm of which is 2.833213344...
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Jul 03 2001
